page.title: 16SOCIAL CONCERNS IN WENHAM
page.content: Much concern has been expressed at local parish council meetings regarding pollution of the stream which is the parish boundary between Capel St.Mary and Great Wenham.Effluent from the pump house in the neighbouring parish overflows into the stream creating a health hazard.This overloading is caused by the great increase in the population of Capel St.Mary.Plans to renew this pumping station in 1987 have been made by the Anglian Water Authori ty In the meantime residents are angry about the lack of maintenance since provision for this has changed from Ipswich to Colchester.Reliance is now placed upon a warning light at the pumping station and a phone number. Deragging operations have to be carried out every 2 to 3 weeks to remove debris such as disposable nappies which clog the pump and are then stored in bins.
